bibl.title: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Henry Rose Carter, March 8, 1916

div1.p: Stimpson reimburses Carter for his expenses.

div1.head: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Henry Rose Carter, March 8, 1916
div1.opener:
AM
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
March 8, 1916.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
Voucher in favor of the Porto Rico Sanatorium
for board and nursing furnished you while sick at
San Juan, P. R., in amount of $28.00, is returned
herewith. Owing to the possibility of there being
some difficulty in your receiving reimbursement from
said sanatorium, it is considered best that bill be
rendered as a reimbursement direct to you. Receipt
for payment of hospital charges should be obtained
and attached to voucher together with letters from
Dr. Glines and Surgeon W. W. king.
By direction of the Surgeon General.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, W. G. Stimpson
Assistant Surgeon General.
P.S.
Explanation of different per diem charges should
be made by you.
